entities.name: mrs weasley

entities.name: mr weasley
entities.description: Mr Weasley is mentioned as being sure about something. ("‘Of course I am!’ said Mr Weasley.")

entities.name: metamorph-medals
entities.description: Metamorph-Medals are mentioned as a reason for someone's lateness. ("‘So is that why you’re late, Metamorph-Medals?’")

entities.name: elephant and castle
entities.description: Elephant and Castle is mentioned as the location of a Backfiring Jinx. ("No, we got wind of a nasty Backfiring Jinx down in Elephant and Castle,")

entities.name: magical law enforcement squad
entities.description: Magical Law Enforcement Squad is mentioned as the ones who sorted out the Backfiring Jinx. ("but luckily the Magical Law Enforce-ment Squad had sorted it out by the time we got there ...")

entities.name: diagon alley
entities.description: Diagon Alley is mentioned as the location where Fred and George are sleeping. ("Oh, they’re in Diagon Alley , sleeping in the little flat over their joke shop as they’re so busy,")

entities.name: joke shop
entities.description: Joke Shop is mentioned as a business owned by Fred and George. ("Oh, they’re in Diagon Alley , sleeping in the little flat over their joke shop as they’re so busy,")

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is mentioned as someone who is being told to go to bed. ("‘Bed,’ said an undeceived Mrs Weasley at once.")

relationships.description: Mr Weasley is mentioned as saying that Fred and George wouldn't do anything like that now, not when people are desperate for protection. ("‘The boys wouldn’t do anything like that now , not when people are desperate for protection!’")

Mr Weasley is mentioned as saying that Fred and George wouldn't do anything like that now, not when people are desperate for protection. ("‘The boys wouldn’t do anything like that now , not when people are desperate for protection!’")
Mrs Weasley is mentioned as telling Harry to go to bed. ("‘Bed,’ said an undeceived Mrs Weasley at once.")

Mrs Weasley is mentioned as saying that she didn't approve of Fred and George sleeping in Diagon Alley, but they seem to have a bit of a flair for business. ("I must say , I didn’t approve at first, but they do seem to have a bit of a flair for business!")
Mrs Weasley is mentioned as saying that she has Fred and George's room all ready for Harry. ("‘I’ve got Fred and George’s room all ready for you, you’ll have it to yourself.’")
